Authors: zhang yu jin, li rong chun
Title:
Studies on the coevolution of Termitomyces and fungus-growing
termites from the Yunnan province of China
Abstract:
In this paper we analyzed the coevolutionary relationship
between Termitomyces and fungus-growing termites. The relationship
between species co-evolution was analyzed by using the connection
method, analysis of molecular variance (AMOVA) and comparative analysis
of topology. From 97 termites nests that were collected from the Yunnan
Province, we extracted 1 sample of Termitomyces and fungus-growing
termites from each nest. The results indicated that termites have no
obvious preference for the type of Termitomyces and the variation of
Termitomyces that were symbiotic with the same termites species was up
to 99.86 percent, the similarity of phylogenetic topology between
Termitomyces and fungus-growing termites was only 28 percent, the
frequency of cospeciations events between Termitomyces and
fungus-growing termites was 0, Few coevolution relationships were
observed between termite mushrooms and termites from Yunnan
province.
